title: [Self-Directed] Language Education Design Through Comparative Analysis of Problem-Based Learning Cases

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational language skills and problem-solving thinking abilities
context.additional_context: Utilization of smartphone-centered supplementary tools in limited technological environments

learning_goals: Learners can compare and explain the characteristics of case problems (complexity, topic, task type) according to various problem-based learning models.
Learners can select and apply appropriate problem-based learning models to solve real-world language-related issues.
Learners can propose effective problem design strategies for language education based on case problem analysis results.

resources: Collaborative Apps for Smartphones (e.g., Google Docs, Padlet)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
